intro: Malcolmia patula, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its medicinal properties have been studied for their potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects.
